sentences.sentence: “My brother and I,” said he, “were very excited about the treasure which my father had spoken of.
For weeks and for months we dug in every part of the garden, without finding it.
It was maddening to think that the hiding-place was on his very lips at the moment that he died.
We could judge the splendor( 壮观 ) of the missing riches by the necklace which he had taken out.
Over this necklace my brother Bartholomew and I had some discussion.
The pearls( 珍珠 ) were evidently of great value, and he did not want to part with them, for my brother was himself a little inclined to( 倾向于 ) my father’s fault.
He thought, too, that if we parted with the necklace it might give rise to( 引起 ) gossip( 流言蜚语 ) and finally bring us into trouble.
Finally I persuaded him to let me find out Miss Morstan’s address and send her a single pearl( 珍珠 ) at fixed intervals, so that at least she might never be completely out of money.”
“It was a kindly thought,” said our companion, earnestly. “It was extremely good of you.”
“We were your trustees( 受托人 ),” he said. “That was the view which I took of it, though Brother Bartholomew did not see it quite that way.
We had plenty of money ourselves. I desired no more.
Besides, it would have been very bad taste( 不得体 ) to have treated a young lady in so mean a fashion( 方式 ).
Our difference of opinion on this subject went so far that I decided to move out: so I left Pondicherry Lodge, taking the old Indian servant and Williams with me.
Yesterday, however, I learnt that the treasure has been discovered.
I instantly communicated with Miss Morstan, and it only remains for us to drive out to Norwood and demand our share.
I explained my views last night to Brother Bartholomew, so we shall be expected, if not welcome, visitors.”
“You have done well, sir, from first to last,” said Holmes. “But, as Miss Morstan remarked just now, it is late, and we had better resolve( 解决 ) this issue without delay.”

Our new acquaintance produced from behind a curtain a very long fur coat, which he buttoned tightly up, and put on a rabbit-skin cap with long ear-flaps, so that no part of him was visible( 可见的 ) except his face.
“My health is somewhat fragile,” he remarked, as he led the way down the passage.
Our cab was awaiting( 等候 ) us outside, and the driver started off at a rapid pace.
Thaddeus Sholto talked incessantly( 不停地 ), in a voice which rose high above the rattle( 嘎嘎声 ) of the wheels.
“Bartholomew is a clever fellow,” said he. “How do you think he found out where the treasure was?
He had come to the conclusion that it was somewhere indoors: so he worked out all the space in the house, and made measurements everywhere, so that not one inch should be unaccounted for( 被遗漏 ).
Among other things, he found that the height of the building was seventy-four feet,
but on adding together the heights of all the separate rooms, and making every allowance for( 考虑到 ) the space between, he could not bring the total to more than seventy feet.
There were four feet unaccounted for. These could only be at the top of the building.
He knocked a hole, therefore, in the lath( 木板条 )-and-plaster( 石灰 ) ceiling of the highest room,
and there, sure enough, he came upon another little attic( 阁楼 ) above it, which had been sealed up and was known to no one.
In the center stood the treasure-chest, resting upon two rafters.
He lowered it through the hole, and there it lies.
He computes the value of the jewels at not less than half a million pounds.”
At the mention of this enormous( 巨大的 ) amount we all stared at one another open-eyed.
Miss Morstan, if we could secure her rights, would change from a poor governess( 家庭女教师 ) to the richest heiress( 女继承人 ) in England.
Surely it was the place of a loyal( 忠实的 ) friend to rejoice( 欣喜 ) at such news; yet I am ashamed to say that selfishness took me by the soul, and that my heart turned as heavy as lead within me.
I stammered out some few words of congratulation, and then sat downcast( 情绪低落的 ), with my head drooped, deaf to the constant talking of our new acquaintance.
I was relieved when our cab stopped suddenly and the coachman( 马车夫 ) sprang down to open the door.
“This, Miss Morstan, is Pondicherry Lodge,” said Mr. Thaddeus Sholto, as he helped her down.
It was nearly eleven o’clock.
We had left the damp fog of the great city behind us, and the night was fairly fine.
A warm wind blew from the westward, and heavy clouds moved slowly across the sky, with half a moon peeping occasionally through the gaps( 间隙 ).
Pondicherry Lodge stood in its own grounds, and was surrounded with a very high stone wall topped with broken glass.
A single narrow door, reinforced( 加固 ) with iron, was the only entrance.
On this our guide knocked with a peculiar( 奇怪的 ) rhythm( 节奏 ).
“Who is there?” cried a bad-tempered voice from within.
“It is I, McMurdo. You surely know my knock by this time.”
There was a grumbling( 发牢骚 ) sound and a jangling of keys.
The door swung heavily back, and a short, powerful man stood in the opening, with the yellow light of the lantern shining on his distrustful( 怀疑的 ) eyes.
“Is that you, Mr. Thaddeus? But who are the others? I had no orders about them from the master.”
“No, McMurdo? You surprise me! I told my brother last night that I would bring some friends.”
“I haven’t seen him today, Mr. Thaddeus, and I have no orders. You know that I must keep to the rules. I can let you in, but your friends must just stay where they are.”
This was an unexpected obstacle( 障碍 ). Thaddeus Sholto looked about him in a confused and helpless manner.
“This is too bad of you, McMurdo!” he said. “If I guarantee them, that is enough for you. There is the young lady, too. She cannot wait on the public road at this hour.”
“Very sorry, Mr. Thaddeus,” said the porter. “They may be friends of yours, but not friends of the master’s. He pays me well to do my duty. I don’t know any of your friends.”
“Oh, yes you do, McMurdo,” cried Sherlock Holmes, genially( 亲切地 ). “I don’t think you can have forgotten me.
Don’t you remember the amateur who fought three rounds with you at Alison’s rooms on the night of your benefit four years back?”
“Mr. Sherlock Holmes!” shouted the prize-fighter( 职业拳击手 ). “If instead of standing there so quiet you’d hit me with that right fist of yours, I’d have known you at once.
You’ve wasted your gifts, you have! You might have aimed high, if you had turned professional( 专业人员 ).”
“You see, Watson, if all else fails me I have still one of the professions( 职业 ) open to me,” said Holmes, laughing. “Our friend won’t keep us out in the cold now, I am sure.”
